standing.

name: Feminist Cultural Study
description:
Histories, theories, and practices of feminist traditions within Cultural
Studies.

name: Multilingual Writing
description:
Development of multilingual writers' composition and English language skills
across genres and disciplines. Integrates college-level reading, critical
thinking, and written communication, using texts from across the curriculum.
prereq:
Enrollment via campus placement (using the English Language Placement Exam or
Analytical Writing Placement Exam) or after successful completion of UWP 022.

name: Cult Rep of Gender
description:
Interdisciplinary investigation of how specific cultures represent gender
difference. Examine a variety of cultural forms and phenomena including film,
television, literature, music, popular movements, and institutions.

name: Interracial Dynamic
description:
Analysis of the influences of cultural differences and racial stratification
on interpersonal interaction in instrumental settings (e.g., work, education,
political action) and intimate settings (e.g., friendship, love, marriage,
family). Minority/majority relationships.

name: Style in the Essay
description:
Principles of style, language, and structure in the essay. Analysis and
development of voice and genre, including sentence revision for force and
clarity, and development of effective paragraphs and essays.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; or equivalent.

name: Dostoevsky (In Eng)
description:
Reading and analysis of Dostoevskys principal works such as Crime and
Punishment, The Idiot, The Brothers Karamazov, and The Diary. Study of social
and political views as reflected in Dostoevskys works.

name: Topics in Public Health
description: Seminar on key issues and current topics in public health.

name: Multilingual Writing
description:
Development of multilingual writers' composition and English language skills
across genres and disciplines. Integrates college-level reading, critical
thinking, and written communication, using texts from across the curriculum.
prereq:
Enrollment via campus placement (using the English Language Placement Exam or
Analytical Writing Placement Exam) or after successful completion of UWP 022.

name: Internship
description:
Lower-division internship for students enrolled in the Sustainable Agriculture
& Food Systems program of study.

name: Intro Gender Studies
description:
Introduction to interdisciplinary, critical gender studies. Addresses the
emergence of womens, gender and feminist studies internationally, its links
to womens movements, and its influence within the various arts, humanities
and social science disciplines.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Feeding the World
description:
Scientific principles and dynamic interactions involved in food production,
food processing, nutrition, and agribusiness. Physical, biological and social
science issues influencing the availability and safety of the food supply
worldwide.

name: Preparatory Chem-SCC110C
description: Not available.

name: Disease & Society
description:
Introduction to the concept of disease, the societal and personal impacts of
past, present and future diseases, and the science behind disease discoveries,
causes, evolution, diagnosis, treatment, and prevention.

name: Principles Lit Criticism
description:
Principles of literary criticism applied to the study of fiction, drama,
poetry, and essay of major literary writers of the Hispanic world.

name: Wine Production
description:
Principles and practices of making standard types of wines, with special
reference to grape varieties used and methods of vinification.
prereq: VEN 003; VEN 123 { can be concurrent }; (BIS 102 or BIS 105)

name: Writing in Science
description:
Writing abstracts, research proposals, scientific papers, other forms of
scientific communication. Presenting data graphically. Primarily for students
engaged in or planning careers in basic or applied research.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing or enrollment in a graduate science curriculum.

name: Internship
description:
Work experience off and on campus in soil science. Internship supervised by a
member of the faculty.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Completion of 84 units.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

Chebyshev's inequality, some special distributions, sampling distributions,
central limit theorem and law of large numbers, point estimation, some methods
of estimation, interval estimation, confidence intervals for certain
quantities, computing sample sizes.

name: Wildl Ecol Conserve
description:
Introduction to the ecology and conservation of vertebrates. Complexity and
severity of world problems in conserving biological diversity.

name: Laboratory Research
description:
Training in specific lab-based research methods coupled with hands-on
experience in a research lab. Students assessed on their ability report and
interpret research findings. Content varies from quarter to quarter.

name: Writ in Intl Relations
description: Advanced instruction in writing in international relations.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Neuroeconomics&Decisions
description:
Theoretical and empirical approaches to neuroeconomics (neuroscience of
decision making) from psychology, neuroscience, economics, and computer
science. Neuroscience of judgment and decision making, behavioral economics,
and reinforcement learning.
prereq:
(PSC 100 or PSC 100Y or PSC 135 or ARE 100A or ECN 100A or NPB 162 or NPB
163); (STA 013 or STA 013Y or STA 100 or PSC 103A); or Consent of Instructor.

name: Cognitive Psychology
description:
Introduction to human information processing, mental representation and
transformation, imagery, attention, memory, language processing, concept
formation, problem solving, and computer simulation.

name: Plant Genetics
description:
Basic principles of transmission genetics, cytogenetics, population and
quantitative genetics, and molecular genetics. Practical aspects of genetic
crosses and analysis of segregating populations.
prereq: BIS 001A or BIS 002A; or Consent of Instructor.

name: Plant Anatomy
description:
Structural anatomy of vascular plants. Training in basic tissue sectioning,
staining, and use of the compound microscope.
prereq: BIS 002C; Or other similar preparation in plant biology.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Introduction to Spanish grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication.

name: Race Relations
description:
Functions of the social definitions of race and racial groups. Analysis of
racial conflict, oppression, and other forms of ethnic stratification. Models
of ethnic interaction and social change. Emphasis on racial relationships
within the U.S.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Writing Social Justice
description:
Advanced instruction in writing for Social Justice, using an interdisciplinary
approach combining feminist, critical race, ethnic, cultural, and
transnational studies; practice in techniques of research and styles of
communication for diverse audiences. Suitable for activists in community
organizing, non-profits, politics.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: College Writing-SCC157P
description: Not available.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Span Lit 1700 to Present
description:
Survey of modern Spanish literature, providing an overview of main literary
movements (romanticism, realism, naturalism, modernism, avantgarde). Emphasis
on the philosophical and historical background and on the European context for
modern Spanish literature. (Part of former SPA 104A & SPA 104B.)
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: Reading & Writing
description:
Development of skills required for success in college-level writing across
genres and disciplines. Integrates reading, critical thinking, and written
communication, using texts from across the curriculum.

name: Indust & Social Change
description:
Selected technological and social factors. Preconditions of economic
development and industrialization. Social, political, and cultural issues at
various levels of economic development. Major historical differences and major
current trends. Emphasis either on highly industrialized countries or on less
developed countries.

name: Internship
description:
Upper-division internship for students enrolled in the Sustainable Agriculture
& Food Systems program of study.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Introduction to Spanish grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: African American Society
description:
Political and social transformations of African American communities between
1790 and 1990, as seen through film, literature, and music. Topics include:
Black consciousness, Afro-Slave culture, The Harlem Renaissance, and
contemporary Hip Hop.

name: Span-Native Speakers I
description:
First course of a three-quarter series designed to provide bilingual students
whose native language is Spanish with the linguistic and learning skills
required for successfully completing upper division courses in Spanish.
Intensive review of grammar and composition.
prereq:
SPA 003 or SPA 003V or SPA 003Y; Or equivalent course or consent of
instructor.

name: Culture & Health
description:
Analysis of how socio-cultural factors shape illness experience. Evaluation of
how certain conditions come to be understood as health conditions; illness
identities and biographies; doctor-patient interactions; biomedical cultures;
and how race, ethnicity, and gender shape health practices.
prereq: SOC 001, SOC 002, SOC 003, or SOC 006 recommended.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Environmental Writing
description:
Advanced instruction in writing and practice in effective styles of
communication in the fields of environmental study, policy, or advocacy.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Intro Multiling Writing
description:
Reading and writing paragraphs and short multi-paragraph texts for academic
purposes. Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Plants & Society
description:
Dependence of human societies on plant and plant products. Plants as resources
for food, fiber, health, enjoyment and environmental services. Sustainable
uses of plants for food production, raw materials, bioenergy, and
environmental conservation. Global population growth and future food supplies.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.

003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-

description: Not available.

name: Honors
description:
Directed reading, research and writing culminating in the preparation of a
Senior Honors Thesis under direction of faculty advisor.
prereq: Senior standing and admission to the Honors Program.

name: Agriculture & Society
description:
Development of agriculture as a major enterprise in modern society with the
concomitant reduction in the labor force and family farms. Analysis of issues
including mechanization, migrant labor, corporate farming, and public resource
policy.

name: Elementary Russian
description:
Introduction to Russian grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication.

name: Intrmed Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing short multi-paragraph texts for academic purposes.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:

name: Social Problems
description:
General sociological consideration of contemporary social problems in relation
to sociocultural change and programs for improvement.

description:

name: The Spanish Black Legend
description:
Examination of anti-Hispanic prejudice in the United States focusing on the
"Black Legend," a 16th-century, anti-Spanish myth underpinning the doctrine of
"Manifest Destiny." Exploration of the Legend's presence in contemporary
American society through interviews and analysis of school textbooks.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Intro To Viticult
description:
Fundamental principles of biology and culture of the grapevine including
taxonomy, morphology, physiology, distribution, domestication, utilization,
propagation, production systems, harvesting, and storage and processing of
grapes. Successful completion should prepare students for upper division
courses in viticulture.

name: Intro To Fem Theory
description:
Introduction to the emergence of feminist theory and to key concepts in
feminist theorizing. Examination of past and current debates over sexuality,
race, identity politics, and the social construction of womens experience.
prereq: WMS 050 recommended or consent of instructor.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Global Social Change
description:
Introduction to change and diversity in world history, including the United
States. Examines population and family, technological change and economic
development, power and status, culture and identity.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Intrmed Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing short multi-paragraph texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Social Interaction
description:
Everyday interaction in natural settings; ethnographic approaches to the
understanding of social meanings, situations, personal identity and human
relationships. Particular attention to the work of Erving Goffman and to
principles of field observation and qualitative analysis.

name: Gender in the Arab World
description:
Examination of the history, culture, and social/political/economic dynamics of
gender relations and gendering in the Arab world.

name: Intro Science Studies
description:
History, philosophy, sociology, politics, and cultural studies of science,
technology, and medicine. Emphasis on a broad range of perspectives.

name: Intro to Prof Editing
description:
Introduction to general editing practices and principles, with an emphasis on
professional editing in organizational contexts, including academia and the
workplace. Extensive practice in copy, comprehensive, and collaborative
editing.
prereq: satisfaction of the upper division writing requirement.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Introduction to reading and composing processes and key rhetorical concepts
for academic literacies. Multiple drafts of composing projects in a variety of
genres and modes with feedback from peers and the instructor.
prereq: Completion of Entry Level Writing Requirement (ELWR).

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.

UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division

description:

prereq:

standing.

name: Wine Production Lab
description:
Current technologies used in production of California table wines; analysis
and monitoring of impact of fermentation variables on microbial performance
and product quality; student-designed independent research project.

name: Writing in Science
description:
Writing abstracts, research proposals, scientific papers, other forms of
scientific communication. Presenting data graphically. Primarily for students
engaged in or planning careers in basic or applied research.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing or enrollment in a graduate science curriculum.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Introduction to reading and composing processes and key rhetorical concepts
for academic literacies. Multiple drafts of composing projects in a variety of
genres and modes with feedback from peers and the instructor.
prereq: Completion of Entry Level Writing Requirement (ELWR).

name: Spec Topic in Journalism
description: Instruction in the elements and practices of advanced journalism.
prereq: Satisfaction of the upper division writing requirement.

name: Applied Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; probability; random variables; expectation; binomial,
normal, Poisson, other univariate distributions; joint distributions; sampling
distributions, central limit theorem; properties of estimators; linear
combinations of random variables; testing and estimation; Minitab computing
package. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
(STA 013 C- or better or STA 013Y C- or better or STA 032 C- or better or STA
100 C- or better); (MAT 016B C- or better or MAT 017B C- or better or MAT 021B
C- or better)

name: Internship in Writing
description:
Internships in fields where students can practice their skills. May be taught
abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 or UWP 001V or UWP 001Y or ENL 003; or equivalent course; consent of
instructor.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Analysis of Variance
description:
Basics of experimental design. One-way and two-way fixed effects analysis of
variance models. Randomized complete and incomplete block design. Multiple
comparisons procedures. One-way random effects model.
prereq:
STA 013 C- or better or STA 013Y C- or better or STA 032 C- or better or STA
100 C- or better

name: Wildlife Ecology
description:
Ecology of wild vertebrates, including habitat selection, spatial
organization, demography, population dynamics, competition, predation,
herbivory, energetics, and community dynamics, set in the context of human-
caused degradation of environments in North America.

name: Intro Latin Amer Culture
description:
Introduction to history, geography and culture of Latin America. Multiple
genres of cultural production and representation, with a focus on cultural
diversity and regional difference. Introduction to critical reading and
textual analysis.

name: Intro Latin Amer Culture
description:
Introduction to history, geography and culture of Latin America. Multiple
genres of cultural production and representation, with a focus on cultural
diversity and regional difference. Introduction to critical reading and
textual analysis. May be taught abroad in a Spanish-speaking country.

name: Writing in Sociology
description:
Advanced instruction in writing and practice in effective styles of
communication in Sociology and related academic and professional fields.
prereq:

003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-

003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-

name: Writing in Education
description:

003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-

description:

description:

name: Intro Multiling Writing
description:

name: Environmental Sociology
description:
Production, consumption, and urban expansion. Basic social logics surrounding
current problems of resource scarcity (environmental extractions) and excess
wastes (environmental additions). Ways that society can change and re-organize
itself to become more environmentally conscious and hence ecologically
sustainable.

name: Water in Popular Culture
description:
Importance of water in many aspects of society as revealed through a survey of
its depictions in film.

name: Intro Sociology
description:
Principles and basic concepts of sociology. The study of groups, culture,
collective behavior, classes and caste, community and ecology, role, status,
and personality.

name: Multilingual Writing
description:
Development of multilingual writers' composition and English language skills
across genres and disciplines. Integrates college-level reading, critical
thinking, and written communication, using texts from across the curriculum.
prereq:
Enrollment via campus placement (using the English Language Placement Exam or
Analytical Writing Placement Exam) or after successful completion of UWP 022.

name: Hist Scientific Writing
description:
History of scientific writing from the 17th century to the present; origins
and evolution of scientific genres; role of scientific writing in producing
scientific knowledge; discursive differences between disciplines; emergence of
English as a global language of science.

name: Regression Analysis
description:
Simple linear regression, variable selection techniques, stepwise regression,
analysis of covariance, influence measures, computing packages.
prereq:
STA 013 C- or better or STA 013Y C- or better or STA 032 C- or better or STA

description:

name: Lab Biol Cons Wild Birds
description:
Laboratory exercises in bird species identification, anatomy, molts, age and
sex, specialized adaptations, behavior, research, with emphasis on
conservation of wild birds. Several weekend field trips, after class bird
walks, and independent bird study are required.
prereq: WFC 111 { can be concurrent }; and Consent of Instructor.

name: Science on Trial
description:
Relationships among law, technology, and science. Scientific evidence and
testimony, biology education, patenting, and sterilization.

description:
Introduction to computing for data analysis and visualization, and simulation,

description:

name: Nonparametric Statistics
description:
Sign and Wilcoxon tests, Walsh averages. Two-sample procedures. Inferences
concerning scale. Kruskal-Wallis test. Measures of association. Chi square and
Kolmogorov-Smirnov tests.

STA 013 C- or better or STA 013Y C- or better or STA 032 C- or better or STA

name: Medical Anthropology
description:
Introduction to critical medical anthropology. Topics include anthropological
analysis of bio-medicine, psychiatry, systems of knowledge and healing, the
body, emotions, and clinical encounters in a cross-cultural perspective.

name: Academic Literacies
description:

name: Spanish Composition II
description:
Development of advanced level writing skills, with emphasis on how to write
argumentative prose, essays, and research papers. Introduction to the analysis
of literary genres. Compositions, journals, individual and group projects.

name: Elementrary Spanish
description:
Continuation of SPA 001 or SPA 001S in the areas of grammar and basic language
skills. Hybrid format combining classroom instruction with technologically
based materials.

name: Intrmed Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing short multi-paragraph texts for academic purposes.

name: Intermediate Spanish
description:
Development of all language skills through exercises and reading of modern
texts. Development on more difficult grammar concepts and further practice on
composition.
prereq: SPA 021 or SPA 021S or SPA 021V or SPA 021Y

name: Directed Gp Study
description: Directed group study. May be taught abroad.
prereq: Consent of instructor and department chairperson.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Introduction to reading and composing processes and key rhetorical concepts
for academic literacies. Multiple drafts of composing projects in a variety of
genres and modes with feedback from peers and the instructor.
prereq: Completion of Entry Level Writing Requirement (ELWR).

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique. May be taught abroad.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or COM
001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C- or better or COM 004 C-
or better or ENL 003 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Sociological Theory
description:
Origins of modern sociological thought. Special emphasis on three major
theorists from the classical tradition of 19th-century European social
thought: Karl Marx, Max Weber, and Emile Durkheim.

name: Statistical Data Science
description:
Introduction to computing for data analysis and visualization, and simulation,
using a high-level language (e.g., R). Computational reasoning,
computationally intensive statistical methods, reading tabular and non-
standard data.
prereq: STA 108 C- or better or STA 106 C- or better

name: Writing in History
description: Advanced instruction in writing in history.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Business Writing Hybrid
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and nonprofit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Writing Science
description:
Texts and writing practices in the production of scientific knowledge. Surveys
the literary structure of scientific arguments; history of scientific genres;
rhetoric and semiotics in scientific culture; graphical systems in the
experimental laboratory; narratives of science, including science fiction.

name: Elementary Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; basic probability concepts; binomial, normal,
Student's t, and chi-square distributions. Hypothesis testing and confidence
intervals for one and two means and proportions. Regression.
prereq: Two years of high school algebra or Mathematics D.

name: Writing in Engineering
description: Advanced instruction in writing in engineering.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Probability Theory
description:
Fundamental concepts of probability theory, discrete and continuous random
variables, standard distributions, moments and moment-generating functions,
laws of large numbers and the central limit theorem.
prereq:
MAT 021C C- or better; (MAT 022A C- or better or MAT 027A C- or better or MAT
067 C- or better); MAT 021D strongly recommended

name: Genres in Prof Writing
description:
Instruction in the elements and practices of professional writing in
specialized genres. May be taught abroad.
prereq: Satisfaction of the upper division writing requirement.

name: Analysis Musts/Wines Lab
description:
Fundamental principles of analytical chemistry as they relate to specific
methods used in winemaking. Laboratory exercises demonstrating various
chemical, physical and biochemical methods. Data will be analyzed and results
interpreted in weekly lab reports; includes student-designed independent
project and written report.
prereq:
VEN 123 { can be concurrent }; CHE 002C; PLS 021; (CHE 008B or CHE 118B or CHE
128B)

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Legal Writing
description:
Advanced principles of critical thinking, argumentation, and style, with
special emphasis on their application in the legal profession. Suitable for
students planning careers in law, business, administration, or management.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Work & Employment
description:
Historical and contemporary overview of employment, work, and occupations in
American society. Study of authority and power relations, labor markets,
control systems, stratification, and corporate structures, and how these
factors shape work in diverse or organizational and employment setting.

name: Reading & Writing
description:
Development of skills required for success in college-level writing across
genres and disciplines. Integrates reading, critical thinking, and written
communication, using texts from across the curriculum.

name: Persuasive Wrtg Multilng
description:
Instruction in analyzing style of persuasive texts, using appropriate
vocabulary, and applying English grammatical structures in argumentation.
Suitable for multilingual students desiring additional instruction in
persuasive English writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better

name: Preparatory Chem-SCC110C
description: Not available.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Biol Cons Fishes
description: Evolution, ecology, and conservation of marine and freshwater fishes.
prereq: BIS 002A; BIS 002B; BIS 002C; Upper division ecology course recommended.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Multilingual Writing
description:
Development of multilingual writers' composition and English language skills
across genres and disciplines. Integrates college-level reading, critical
thinking, and written communication, using texts from across the curriculum.
prereq:
Enrollment via campus placement (using the English Language Placement Exam or
Analytical Writing Placement Exam) or after successful completion of UWP 022.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Introduction to reading and composing processes and key rhetorical concepts
for academic literacies. Multiple drafts of composing projects in a variety of
genres and modes with feedback from peers and the instructor.
prereq: Completion of Entry Level Writing Requirement (ELWR).

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Writing in Education
description:
Advanced expository writing in the contemporary American classroom. Strongly
recommended for teaching credential candidates.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Internship Community Hth
description:
The student, through fieldwork in a community health agency, learns to apply
theory and concepts learned in the classroom.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division and graduate students.

name: Oral English
description:
Intensive work in oral English for international students, to increase
fluency, accuracy, and use of appropriate discourse strategies in academic
settings; e.g., seminar, discussion, laboratory. Training in segmental
features of English sounds, intonation, stress, non-verbal cues, and register.

name: Anly Categor Data
description:
Varieties of categorical data, cross-classifications, contingency tables,
tests for independence. Multidimensional tables and log-linear models, maximum
likelihood estimation; tests of goodness-of-fit. Logit models, linear logistic
models. Analysis of incomplete tables. Packaged computer programs, analysis of
real data.

name: Reading & Writing
description:
Development of skills required for success in college-level writing across
genres and disciplines. Integrates reading, critical thinking, and written
communication, using texts from across the curriculum.

name: Intermed Soc Stat
description:
Intermediate level course in statistical analysis of social data, emphasizing
the logic and use of statistical measures, procedures, and mathematical models
especially relevant to sociological analysis.

name: College Writing-SCC157P
description: Not available.

name: The Family
description:
Contemporary family life in historical and cross-cultural perspective. How
different family forms arose, their significance today and prospects for
further family change. Attention to power relations within and beyond the
family and to the social implications of family transformation.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study.

name: Immigration
description:
Social and demographic analysis of immigration: motives and experiences of
immigrants; immigration and social mobility; immigration, assimilation, and
social change; multicultural societies. Detailed study of immigration into the
U.S., with comparative studies of Europe, Australia, and other host countries.

name: Internship Community Hth
description:
Students apply theory and concepts learned in the classroom through field work
in a community health agency.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Lower division standing.

name: Writing for Anthroplogy
description:
Advanced instruction in writing and practice in effective styles of
communication in Anthropology and related academic and professional fields.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; 4 or 5 on AP
English Lit and Comp exam; or 6 or better on IB HL English Exam.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Continuation of SPA 001, SPA 001S, or previous high school experience in the
areas of grammar and basic language skills. Online format combining
synchronous chatting with technologically based materials.
prereq: SPA 001 or SPA 001S or SPA 001Y; Or the equivalent.

name: Latin Amer Lit 1900 Pres
description:
Latin American literature from 1900 to the present. Reading selections include
fiction, poetry, drama, essays, testimonio, etc.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including corporations,
government agencies, and non-profit. Suitable for students entering careers
such as management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq:
UWP 001 C- or better or UWP 001V C- or better or UWP 001Y C- or better or ENL
003 C- or better or COM 001 C- or better or COM 002 C- or better or COM 003 C-
or better or COM 004 C- or better or NAS 005 C- or better; and upper division
standing.

name: Topics in Lat Am Lit Cul
description:
Special topics in the study of Latin American literature and culture. May be
taught abroad in a Spanish speaking country under the supervision of UC Davis
faculty.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S
